findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to stop or pause transactions
findings.description: The contract owner does not have the ability to stop or pause transactions.

findings.title: Contract Owner has authority to transfer user's tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to transfer any balance to the owner’s contract by setting an account to an address that holds tokens and executing the withdraw function.

findings.title: Owner Transfer User's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to transfer any balance to the owner’s contract.

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to increase fees more than a reasonable percent (25%)
findings.description: The contract owner has limited authority to increase fees up to 25%

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to increase the amount of liquidity taken by dev wallet more than a reasonable percent
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to transfer any balance to the owner’s contract and may take advantage of it, but there is a limit to increasing the amount of liquidity taken by dev wallet.

findings.title: Contract Owner is able to transfer user's tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to transfer any balance to the owner’s contract.

findings.title: Contract Owner has authority to transfer user's tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to transfer any balance to the owner’s contract by setting an account to an address that holds tokens and executing the withdraw function.

findings.title: Contract Owner is not able to blacklist wallets from selling
findings.description: The contract owner lacks the ability to blacklist specific wallets from selling tokens.

findings.title: Public Function could be Declared External
findings.description: Public functions that are never called by the contract should be declared external to save gas.

findings.title: Using Variables before Declaration
findings.description: The contract is using a variable before the declaration. This is usually happening either if it has not been declared yet or the variable has been declared in a different scope.
